description: The Dow sits at a record high this morning and looks like it could go higher today. What does it mean for ordinary investors? Global oil markets are steady this morning after the death of the Hugo Chavez in Venezuela which has the world's second largest oil reserves. And, Harley-Davidson factories just got a little less cool. The company is no longer allowing music to be played on the assembly lines because of safety concerns.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, March 6, 2013

title: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, March 6, 2013
byline: Eve Troeh, Erin Toner, Jeff Tyler, Irene Caselli, Will Oremus, Paddy Hirsch, David Brancaccio, Jeremy Hobson, Nancy Marshall-Genzer and Christopher Werth
